explanation:
For MISRA unreachable-code analysis we must know which conditions can actually occur and which calls may alter control flow or produce/require non-NULL objects. Reasons per symbol:

- strcmp
  - Used in the initial method check (if (0 != strcmp(method, "GET"))). The analyzer needs strcmp semantics to determine whether that branch can be true/false and thus whether the early return (MHD_NO) is reachable.

- memcmp
  - Used to compare username/password buffers. Its semantics determine whether the credential-comparison branches can be true/false (i.e. whether the "wrong username or password" and "success" branches are reachable).

- strlen
  - Used to compare literal lengths against username_len/password_len. Knowing strlen semantics is necessary to evaluate those length comparisons for reachability.

- MHD_basic_auth_get_username_password3
  - Returns auth_info (or NULL). Reachability of the three major branches (auth_info == NULL, auth_info invalid credentials, auth_info valid) depends directly on possible return values/contract of this function.

- struct MHD_BasicAuthInfo (username, username_len, password, password_len)
  - The code inspects these fields. The analyzer needs the exact definitions and documented invariants (e.g. the comment that password == NULL implies password_len == 0) to determine if some checks are redundant or impossible (thus unreachable).

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static
  - Produces the response object used in all three response paths. If this can fail/return NULL or have side effects, that affects whether subsequent cleanup and return code paths are reachable.

- MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3
  - Called for the auth-required and bad-credentials branches and returns an MHD_Result stored in ret. Its return contract affects whether those return values/paths are viable.

- MHD_queue_response
  - Called in the success branch and returns an MHD_Result. Its behavior determines whether the success branch completes as written and what ret value can be returned.

- MHD_free
  - Frees auth_info when non-NULL. If MHD_basic_auth_get_username_password3 never returns heap-allocated data, the free would be unreachable/invalid; conversely, if it always returns allocated data the free is always reachable. Analyzer needs its contract.

- MHD_destroy_response
  - Always called on response before return. If response can be NULL or certain response-creation calls never return, that affects reachability of the destroy call and following code.

- MHD_YES, MHD_NO, MHD_HTTP_OK (enum/result constants)
  - Values returned/compared by the function and by queue functions; required to reason about which return statements and result-handling branches are applicable and whether any return statements are redundant or unreachable.

These symbols together provide the contracts and semantics needed to decide whether any of the conditional branches or cleanup calls in answer_to_connection can never be executed and thus constitute unreachable code under MISRA.
